org.apache.juneau.rest

Class BasicRestCallHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.rest.BasicRestCallHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RestCallHandler

    public class BasicRestCallHandler
extends Object
implements RestCallHandler
    Default implementation of RestCallHandler.

    Subclasses can override these methods to tailor how HTTP REST calls are handled.
    Subclasses MUST implement a public constructor that takes in a RestContext object.

    See Also:
    • RestContext.REST_callHandler

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.apache.juneau.rest.RestCallHandler

      • createRequest

        public RestRequest createRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
                          throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        Creates a RestRequest object based on the specified incoming HttpServletRequest object.

        Subclasses may choose to override this method to provide a specialized request object.

        Specified by:
        createRequest in interface RestCallHandler
        Parameters:
        req - The request object from the service(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) method.
        Returns:
        The wrapped request object.
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - If any errors occur trying to interpret the request.

      • createResponse

        public RestResponse createResponse(RestRequest req,
                                   javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse res)
                            throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        Creates a RestResponse object based on the specified incoming HttpServletResponse object and the request returned by createRequest(HttpServletRequest).

        Subclasses may choose to override this method to provide a specialized response object.

        Specified by:
        createResponse in interface RestCallHandler
        Parameters:
        req - The request object returned by createRequest(HttpServletRequest).
        res - The response object from the service(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) method.
        Returns:
        The wrapped response object.
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - If any errors occur trying to interpret the request or response.

             throws javax.servlet.ServletException,

        Subclasses can optionally override this method if they want to tailor the behavior of requests.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        r2 - The incoming HTTP servlet response object.

      • handleResponse

        public void handleResponse(RestRequest req,
                           RestResponse res)
                    throws IOException,
                           RestException,
                           NotImplemented
        The main method for serializing POJOs passed in through the RestResponse.setOutput(Object) method or returned by the Java method.

        Subclasses may override this method if they wish to modify the way the output is rendered or support other output formats.

        The default implementation simply iterates through the response handlers on this resource looking for the first one whose ResponseHandler.handle(RestRequest, RestResponse) method returns true.

        Specified by:
        handleResponse in interface RestCallHandler
        Parameters:
        req - The HTTP request.
        res - The HTTP response.
        Throws:
        IOException
        RestException
        NotImplemented

      • handleNotFound

        public void handleNotFound(int rc,
                           RestRequest req,
                           RestResponse res)
                    throws NotFound,
                           PreconditionFailed,
                           MethodNotAllowed,
                           javax.servlet.ServletException
        Handle the case where a matching method was not found.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide a 2nd-chance for specifying a response. The default implementation will simply throw an exception with an appropriate message.

        Specified by:
        handleNotFound in interface RestCallHandler
        Parameters:
        rc - The HTTP response code.
        req - The HTTP request.
        res - The HTTP response.
        Throws:
        NotFound
        PreconditionFailed
        MethodNotAllowed
        javax.servlet.ServletException

      • handleError

        public void handleError(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse res,
                        Throwable e)
                 throws IOException
        Method for handling response errors.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own custom error response handling.

        Specified by:
        handleError in interface RestCallHandler
        Parameters:
        req - The servlet request.
        res - The servlet response.
        e - The exception that occurred.
        Throws:
        IOException - Can be thrown if a problem occurred trying to write to the output stream.

      • getSessionObjects

        public Map<String,Object> getSessionObjects(RestRequest req)
        Returns the session objects for the specified request.

        The default implementation simply returns a single map containing {'req':req}.

        Specified by:
        getSessionObjects in interface RestCallHandler
        Parameters:
        req - The REST request.
        Returns:
        The session objects for that request.
